trans-unit.source: Database-side JDBC routines and nested connections

seg-source.mrk: Database-side JDBC routines and nested connections

target.mrk: Database-side JDBC routines and nested connections

trans-unit.source: Most database-side JDBC routines need to share the same transaction space as the statements that called them.

seg-source.mrk: Most database-side JDBC routines need to share the same transaction space as the statements that called them.

target.mrk: Most database-side JDBC routines need to share the same transaction space as the statements that called them.

trans-unit.source: to ensure that any updates done from within the routine are atomic with the outer transaction

seg-source.mrk: to ensure that any updates done from within the routine are atomic with the outer transaction

target.mrk: to ensure that any updates done from within the routine are atomic with the outer transaction

trans-unit.source: In order to use the same transaction, the routine must use the same connection as the parent SQL statement in which the routine was executed. Connections re-used in this way are called nested connections.

seg-source.mrk: In order to use the same transaction, the routine must use the same connection as the parent SQL statement in which the routine was executed.
Connections re-used in this way are called nested connections.

target.mrk: In order to use the same transaction, the routine must use the same connection as the parent SQL statement in which the routine was executed.
Connections re-used in this way are called nested connections.

trans-unit.source: Use the connection URL jdbc:default:connection to re-use the current Connection.

seg-source.mrk: Use the connection URL jdbc:default:connection to re-use the current Connection.

target.mrk: Use the connection URL jdbc:default:connection to re-use the current Connection.

trans-unit.source: The database donnection URL jdbc:default:connection allows a Java method to get the Connection of the SQL statement that called it. This is the standard (SQL standard, Part 13, SQL Routines and Java) mechanism to obtain the nested connection object. The method would get a Connection as follows:

seg-source.mrk: The database donnection URL jdbc:default:connection allows a Java method to get the Connection of the SQL statement that called it.
This is the standard (SQL standard, Part 13, SQL Routines and Java) mechanism to obtain the nested connection object.
The method would get a Connection as follows:

target.mrk: The database donnection URL jdbc:default:connection allows a Java method to get the Connection of the SQL statement that called it.
This is the standard (SQL standard, Part 13, SQL Routines and Java) mechanism to obtain the nested connection object.
The method would get a Connection as follows:

trans-unit.source: URL attributes are not supported as part of this connection URL. Any URL attributes specified in a Properties object, user name, or password that are passed to a java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection() call will be ignored.

seg-source.mrk: URL attributes are not supported as part of this connection URL.
Any URL attributes specified in a Properties object, user name, or password that are passed to a java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection() call will be ignored.

target.mrk: URL attributes are not supported as part of this connection URL.
Any URL attributes specified in a Properties object, user name, or password that are passed to a java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection() call will be ignored.

trans-unit.source: Loading a JDBC driver in a database-side routine is not required.

seg-source.mrk: Loading a JDBC driver in a database-side routine is not required.

target.mrk: Loading a JDBC driver in a database-side routine is not required.
